    • Method Detail

      • getSplit

        public static java.lang.String[] getSplit(java.lang.String st,
                                          java.lang.String ch)
        Splits a String into many parts using a specified token then returns a String array containing the first part and all the other parts combine.

        So getSplit("java.io.IOException", ".") will return {"java", "io.IOException"}
        Parameters:
        st - the initial String
        ch - the token to split
        Returns:
        a String array with length 2 containing the answer

      • exportMatricies

        public static void exportMatricies(java.lang.String file,
                                   Matrix[] M)
        Exports multiple matrix into a plain text file.

        For every matrix, the method will write the dimensions for the matrix in 1 line and then start to write out lines of the matrix.
        This method should only be used to export .synapses files
        Parameters:
        file - the file name to export into
        M - the array of matrix to export

      • importMatricies

        public static Matrix[] importMatricies(java.lang.String file)
        Imports multiple matrix into a plain text file.

        This method will keep on importing until an Exception occurs or the file has ended.
        Thus the matricies must be located at the end of the file and should only be used to open .synapses files.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to import the matricies
        Returns:
        the imported array of matrix

      • exportSynx

        public static void exportSynx(java.lang.String path,
                              Matrix[] M)
                       throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Exports an array of matrix onto a .synx file.

        Guidelines for the .synx file can be found on this documentation
        Parameters:
        path - the directory of the file and the file name itself
        M - the array of matrix to export
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever it detected the path don't have a recognizable extension
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever there's something wrong with the stream writing function

        Returns:

        Throws:

        public static float[][] addBias(float[][] inp)
        Adds a column containing 1 to a 2d float array.

        This is to simulate the bias artificially.
        Parameters:
        inp - the 2d float array to add the column into
        Returns:
        the transformed 2d float array

      • addBias

        public static float[][] addBias(float[][] inp,
                                float bias)
        Adds a column containing a specified floating point value to a 2d float array.

        This is to simulate the bias artificially.
        Parameters:
        inp - the 2d float array to add the column into
        bias - the value that will be added into the extra column
        Returns:
        the transformed 2d float array

        the transformed matrix

      • reconstructImage

        public processing.core.PImage reconstructImage(float[] data)
        Reconstructs the image from a single floating point array.

        This method will try to guess the image dimensions and begin loading it with information from the floating point array.
        Parameters:
        data - the image data
        Returns:
        the image reconstructed

      • displayNumbers

        public processing.core.PGraphics displayNumbers(Matrix X,
                                                int resolution,
                                                int width,
                                                int height)
        Displays the data in a matrix as an image.

        The image loading procedure can be found at reconstructImage(float[])
        Parameters:
        X - the matrix that contains the images that we want to display
        resolution - the resolution of the individual images
        width - the width of the screen that contains the images
        height - the height of the screen that contains the images
        Returns:
        the PGraphics element that contains our images

      • displayNumbers

        public processing.core.PGraphics displayNumbers(Matrix X)
        Displays the data in a matrix as an image with some default values.

        This method will call displayNumbers(Matrix, int, int, int) directly containing some default values:
        - Resolution will be the square root of the number of columns the data has, rounded down.
        - Width and height will both be 300.
        Parameters:
        X - the matrix that contains all the images we want to display
        Returns:
        the PGraphics element that contains our images

      • loadMNIST

        public static void loadMNIST(java.lang.String path,
                             int maxSize,
                             _Float progress,
                             Matrix ans)
        Reads from stream a number of MNIST images.

        The method will automatically identify what file type it has and will import it seamlessly
        Parameters:
        path - the absolute path to the MNIST file
        maxSize - the maximum size of the data set we want to import
        progress - the attachable progress element
        ans - the answer variable that the method will return into
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever there's something wrong with the stream reading function
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever it encounters an unrecognized file type

      • export3d

        public static void export3d(processing.core.PApplet proc,
                            _Float progress,
                            Network net,
                            Matrix lX,
                            Matrix lP,
                            processing.core.PVector synNum,
                            processing.core.PVector p0,
                            processing.core.PVector p1,
                            java.lang.String path,
                            processing.core.PVector shift,
                            int tag)
        Exports the 3d error graph. This involves sampling the network a lot of times when change 2 specified weights. Imagine a square with 4 corners at (25, 25), (25, -25), (-25, 25), (-25, -25). Remember that (0, 0) will be the current state of the network. This method will sample every natural coordinates in and on that square given the size of the square. After doing so, it calculates the networks received and pass the first 3 elements of the test set into it. The error values are then outputted into a 3d graph. Also, this method will export the graphs in 5 scales (the size of the side of the square): 1, 10, 100, 1000, 10000
        Parameters:
        proc - the main sketch
        progress - the progress tracker variable
        net - the network to deviate
        lX - the input test set
        lP - the correct answer for the input test set
        synNum - contains 2 numbers, first number is the first layer of two that the first connection tweak located, second number for the second connection
        p0 - the location of the first connection. That means the first connection is located at syn[synNum.x].ea[p0.x][p0.y]
        p1 - the location of the second connection. That means the second connection is located at syn[synNum.y].ea[p1.x][p1.y]
        path - the path to the intended output file. Must have an extension of ".3dg"
        shift - shift the center location away from the origin. See the code for more details.
        tag - any additional tags but this parameter is currently not in use
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever the target file doesn't have the .3dg extension
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever there is something wrong with writing to the file
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever there is something wrong while closing the file

      • export3d

        public static void export3d(processing.core.PApplet proc,
